cyclone.name: BILL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles SSE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the central Texas coast with landfall expected Tuesday morning, then moving inland across south-central Texas

weather_observation.warning_coast: Baffin Bay to High Island, Texas (includes upper Texas coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Baffin Bay through Galveston Bay and the upper Texas coastline including Beaumont/Port Arthur
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds of 39–50 mph with higher gusts possible Tuesday at Beaumont/Port Arthur
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft above ground possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass/Beaumont
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches possible, leading to flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Freshwater flooding of low-lying areas and the potential for brief tornadoes in outer rain bands
